meanings.definition: A person who copies out documents, especially one employed to do this before printing was invented.
meanings.sent1: The scribes meticulously copied the ancient scrolls by hand.
meanings.sent2: The scribes in the monastery spent hours transcribing the religious texts.
meanings.sent3: The scribes had a race to see who could copy the fastest!
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so neat, she was like a scribe of the modern age.
meanings.sent5: The scribes' room was filled with the rustling of parchment and scratching of quills.

meanings.definition: A person who writes books or documents by hand as a profession.
meanings.sent1: The scribes in the Middle Ages were highly skilled in calligraphy.
meanings.sent2: The scribes of old used ink and quills to create beautiful manuscripts.
meanings.sent3: The scribes' hands were always stained with ink from their work.
meanings.sent4: She was a scribe of stories, weaving tales with her pen.
meanings.sent5: The scribes' work was admired for its precision and elegance.

meanings.sent1: She carefully scribed her name onto the cover of the book.
meanings.sent2: The artist scribed intricate patterns onto the clay tablet.
meanings.sent3: He scribed a secret message on the back of the map.
meanings.sent4: The memory was scribed into his mind like a permanent mark.
meanings.sent5: The poet scribed his emotions onto the blank page, creating a masterpiece.
